qas.question: How many comarcas does Galicia consist of?
How many of its numerous named locations are communities?

context: Galicia is further divided into <a0_0>53<a0_0/> comarcas, <a1_0>315<a1_0/> municipalities (93 in A Coruña, 67 in Lugo, 92 in Ourense, 62 in Pontevedra) and <a2_0>3,778<a2_0/> parishes. Municipalities are divided into parishes, which may be further divided into aldeas ("hamlets") or lugares ("places"). This traditional breakdown into such small areas is unusual when compared to the rest of Spain. Roughly half of the named population entities of Spain are in Galicia, which occupies only 5.8 percent of the country's area. It is estimated that Galicia has over a million named places, over <a3_0>40,000<a3_0/> of them being communities.
